summary: Contributed talk at NeurIPS2020, workshop on Machine Learning for Molecules.
title: MEG: Molecular Explanation Generator

summary: We present a novel approach to tackle explainability of deep graph networks in the context of molecule property prediction tasks, named MEG (Molecular Explanation Generator). We generate informative counterfactual explanations for a specific prediction under the form of (valid) compounds with high structural similarity and different predicted properties. We discuss preliminary results showing how the model can convey non-ML experts with key insights into the learning model focus in the neighborhood of a molecule.
title: Explaining Deep Graph Networks with Molecular Counterfactuals
